alert.note: Alert for Curry County; De Baca County; Quay County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 8:06PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN ROOSEVELT, NORTHEASTERN DE BACA, SOUTHWESTERN QUAY AND SOUTHWESTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM MDT... At 805 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Ragland to 6 miles west of Sumner Lake. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Sumner, Melrose, House, Tolar, Taiban, Sumner Lake State Park, Sumner Lake and Mcalister. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 313 and 368. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Frequent dangerous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for east central New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Curry County; De Baca County; Quay County; Roosevelt County
